moves.1. e4 c5 2. Bc4 e6: e6 is my usual defense for the strong bishop at c4.
moves.3. Nc3 d6 4. d4 cxd4 5. Qxd4 Nc6 6. Qe3: A total unnecessary sacriface of knight, he might wish to keep his strong bishop intact.
moves.8... axb5 9. Bxb5 Qa5+: Always be aware of open diagonal pointing towards the king. I took advantage of the open diagonal. He is losing the bishop for nothing.
moves.10. Bd2 Qxb5 11. b3 Ba6: I made mistake here. that is not the right place for bishop. I wished for the development, b7 was better.
moves.12. c4 Qb7 13. O-O Nf6 14. h3 Be7 15. Rf: Both my bishops are pointing towards his castle building tremendous pressure.
moves.22. f4: a big mistake, players might make mistake under pressure.
moves.22... Qc6 23. Re2 Rad8: bringing more units to the war field(development move)
moves.30. Rg1 Qb2: my bishop, rook, queen is coordinated now towards the king.
